subject: Re: Text Conversion
msgSnippet: Be careful using the dictionaries on this group.  They re very susceptible to regional accent.  I d also like to refer you to
messageBody:
Be careful using the dictionaries on this group. They're very
susceptible to regional accent. I'd also like to refer you to
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/message/292 , where I
verbosely and antagonistically suggest a rather large and extensive
project for creating a "universal" dialect of quickscript that
sacrifices regional variation in favor of legibility.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Chuck Peck <chuck091956@y...>
wrote:
> Hello All,
>
> I'm in the process of building a Perl Script to convert Orthodox
character text files into QuickScript ones. It will use the database
that generated the dictionary that is in the Files section. I'm
currently working on the grammar/phonics rules that will try to
convert works not in the database into their phonic equivalent. I
think I have someone who will convert the formatted MS Word docs
into Adobe PDF for me.
>
> Once its done... hopefully sometime next month, I'm going to start
converting some of the Gutenberg classic text pieces into QS. If
anyone has any recommendations of writings they'd like to see in QS
please let me know.
>
> I'll update the group as I get closer to completing it.
>
>
> Chuck
>
>
>
> ---------------------------------
> Do you Yahoo!?
> SBC Yahoo! DSL - Now only $29.95 per month!

Be careful using the dictionaries on this group.  They're very 
susceptible to regional accent.  I'd also like to refer you to 
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/message/292 , where I 
verbosely and antagonistically suggest a rather large and extensive 
project for creating a "universal" dialect of quickscript that 
sacrifices regional variation in favor of legibility.

> Hello All,

> I'm in the process of building a Perl Script to convert Orthodox 
character text files into QuickScript ones. It will use the database 
that generated the dictionary that is in the Files section. I'm 
currently working on the grammar/phonics rules that will try to 
convert works not in the database into their phonic equivalent. I 
think I have someone who will convert the formatted MS Word docs 
into Adobe PDF for me.
>  
> Once its done... hopefully sometime next month, I'm going to start 
converting some of the Gutenberg classic text pieces into QS. If 
anyone has any recommendations of writings they'd like to see in QS 
please let me know.

> I'll update the group as I get closer to completing it.
